channel.title: CiTR -- Queer FM
channel.description: Queer FM combines in-depth analysis of LGTB current events with human interest stories, arts coverage and news items from around the world; plus information local community events and great music by artists of all sexual orientations and gender identities!

item.title: Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded - Let the ranting commence!

item.title: Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded - YOU get a broadcast! And YOU get a broadcast!
item.description:
Everybody's getting Queer Eff-eeeeeeehmmmmmm! Grab your own Gail and tune in as we talk politics, rock some awesome tunes, and tackle the big stuff. And the small stuff, we're no size queens. Well, not all of us. Time to stick something big in your ears... and we're HUGE!

item.title: Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded - Fruits in the Breeze
item.description:
Guess whose back, back again... the QFMVR gang is hanging out, takin' names, makin' a mess and eating assorted fruits. PLUS, we welcome Peter Breeze to the studio and to the pre-noon coffee fest of morning radio! It's comfy in your head, let's stay here a while. Wonder what #fartingsparkles is all about? Well, you'll have to listen in and find out!

Come on in for your weekly dose of awesome, Queer FM style!

item.title: Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded - The Grab-bag Edition
item.description:
Barb, Jared and DJ Denise are back with this week's episode of Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded! Two fisting bananas, your weekly estrogen hour fix and much, MUCH more.
Join us as we talk politics, world news, and have some fun - plus Barb tells you where to go and how to get there. DJ Denise drops by and spins a whole lot of old-school booty-shaking to wake you up right! It's "any freshman at the controls of a radio station", but so much better.
Barb Snelgrove & Jared Knudsen voice-hump your ear-holes on this week's QueerFM Vancouver RELOADED!

item.title: Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded - PRIDE EDITION & Velvet Answers!
item.description:
Barb, Jared and DJ Denise are back with this week's extra special Pride Edition that you've been waiting all week... ALL YEAR for! Here we go again, moist and fresh! PLUS, Velvet takes YOUR questions during the World Premiere of Velvet Answers - another Queer FM Vancouver : Reloaded FIRST!
Join us as we dish up the dirt as well as our weekly features - Barb Snelgrove sharing her TOP picks for what YOU *should* be doing this week on VanBag. DJ Denise spinning some rockin' tunes, David C. Jones talks THEATRE goodness...and a very special reflection on Pride from Jared this week.
Join Barb Snelgrove & Jared Knudsen as we voice-hump your ear-holes on this week's QueerFM Vancouver RELOADED!

item.title: QueerFM Vancouver : RELOADED - Vancouver Frontrunners!
item.description:
Barb, Jared, and DJ Denise are back for that bit of Rainbow Fabulousness many of you (hello Harvard!) wait for ALL WEEK! Here we go again...hard hats ON - yeah...they're still constructing our new building at CiTR!
QueerFM Vancouver is RELOADED.
Vancouver Frontrunners are in the HOUSE...to talk about the upcoming PRIDE Walk & Run...and give us just a TASTE - but no spoilers - of the coolness and fun YOU can have. Listen in to get the deets!
Join us as we dish up the dirt as well as our weekly features - Barb Snelgrove sharing her TOP picks for what YOU *should* be doing this week on VanBag. DJ Denise spinning some rockin' tunes, Velvet SAYS (and you should LISTEN - especially before PRIDE Week)...and just WHAT made Jared laugh - or get really PISSED - THIS week!
Join Barb Snelgrove & Jared Knudsen as we talk - A LOT - on this week's QueerFM Vancouver RELOADED!
You've got yourself another QueerFM Cocktail - served straight up. No apologies... ;)

item.description:

QueerFM Vancouver is RELOADED.
It's a free for all this morning - you just have to listen in.
Join us as we dish up the dirt as well as our weekly features - Barb Snelgrove sharing her TOP picks for what YOU *should* be doing this week on VanBag. Join Barb Snelgrove & Jared Knudsen as we talk - A LOT - on this week's QueerFM RELOADED!

item.title: Rainbow24 : LIVE at the Cobalt!
item.description:
Rainbow 24 : LGBTQ Voices 2012 4PM-6PM All the voices, music & Mayhem CiTR's QueerFM Vancouver
Experience it LIVE as CiTR paints the airwaves - Rainbow!
A part of CiTR's Rainbow 24 : LGBTQ Voices 2012 (https://www.facebook.com/events/320094774722351/), this LIVE show at the Cobalt, ALSO broadcast LIVE on CiTR 101.9FM, features the BEST of CiTR's Rainbow lineup!
...MC 'The Bovine Miss M' brings joy, laughter and a viscous put down (if you've got it coming)...and she'll make sure we're on time and moving the show along! Experience the burlesque brilliance of the LOVELY Maggie Pie in not one, but TWO hot Queer burlesque numbers...
That's just for starters...
The QueerFM Team is also on the case! Aedan Saint (in his LAST broadcast in Canada), and new host Jared Knudsen team up to bring you comedy GOLD! QueerFM Theatre Impresario David C. Jones and The BOBBERS Queer Comedy Improv Troupe will make you laugh your ASS off!
Couple that with hopping DJs, and of course the witty comedic sass of QueerFM Arts Xtra Culture Host - Barb Snelgrove!
Much MORE on the slate...performers confirming by the day...it's going to be a great three hours of radio fabulousness - and history.
Come OUT to the Cobalt and support CiTR Radio...and BE ENTERTAINED!
The BEST of Rainbow 24 - LIVE! Be a PART of History...
Rainbow 24 LIVE at The COBALT! Friday, June 1st, 2012 7-10PM The Cobalt 917 Main Street Vancouver BC
AND...catch it LIVE on: CiTR 101.9FM Vancouver or streaming at citr.ca

item.title: QueerFM : Aedan's LAST QueerFM!
item.description:
It's Aedan Saint's LAST QueerFM. Yep...two years of up to three (or more) broadcasts per week...and it's OVER. Join us as we say goodbye to Aedan...and have some fun in the process! QueerFM's NEW Producer/Host Jared Knudsen and QueerFM's Outgoing Producer/Host Aedan Saint - tagteam for the good, the bad, and the WTF!?!
Ryan Clayton will return next week from Victoria with Canadian Shorts, but Aedan & Jared pick up the political slack and talk Canadian politics and crazy. Aedan Saint retorts, as uaual, with even MORE American WTF Politics & News...and that's just ONE HOUR of the show! Great music and LGBTQ news and weirdness from around the world - and we're here at QueerFM to make sense of it all!
Music from Jared's dytopian yet cool playlist rounds off QueerFM's roundup of the cool, not so cool and downright WTF?!? events of the past week as well as add their own spin on the crazy!
It's another QueerFM cocktail...straight up, no ice...

item.title: QueerFM : Obama Comes OUT (sort of)
item.description:
It's a NEW DAY in the world of LGBTQ Equality as President Barack Obama comes out in FAVOR of Marriage Equality...or was he (sorta) outed? Regardless - QueerFM's NEW Producer/Host Jared Knudsen and QueerFM's Outgoing Producer/Host Aedan Saint - tagteam this issue with Conservative reaction, ELLEN'S reaction...and much more!
Ryan Clayton reports from Victoria with his new segment - Canadian Shorts...and he reaches deep into those shorts to deliver the goods! Aedan Saint retorts with even MORE American WTF Politics & News...and that's just ONE HOUR of the show! item.title: QueerFM: Spencer Chandra Herbert on the Drive!
item.description:
It's been yet ANOTHER contentious and fantastic week - and we're here at QueerFM to make sense of it all!
Aedan Saint & Ryan Clayton meet up with Vancouver West End MLA Spencer Chandra Herbert to talk life, politics and everything on Commercial Drive in a one hour QueerFM Exclusive interview - ok...it's more of a candid discussion. We are SO pleased to have him on the show.
Barb Snelgrove makes a SPECIAL Sunday night VanBag appearance with ALL your events and happenings of merit in Vancouver and beyond!
Aedan & Ryan round off with their roundup of the cool, not so cool and downright WTF?!? events of the past week as well as add their own spin on the crazy!
Couple THAT with in studio conversation with Ryan's review of gay relationships in Mass Effect 3, closing of the Vancouver Playhouse Company (and the bailout) and MUCH more! MUCHO COOL music from all over the FAB spectrum including Aedan's pick of the week - and you've got yourself yet another QueerFM cocktail...straight up, no ice...with a twist!
Making life more fabulous, one person at a time...

item.title: QueerFM : Tempermental Green
item.description:
A hearty THANK YOU to our listeners for your support of our shows - QueerFM's family of shows appreciate your support during this year's CiTR FunDrive! If you'd like to give a bit (missed the show last week) check out CiTR.ca and DONATE!
Celebrating 18 years of LGBTQ programming AND on the Trans Day of Remembrance....we serve up drama AND joy...
We start off with News briefs and discussion with Justin & Jennifer manning the broadcast booth including a Vancouver City Elections roundup...then...
We review The Tempermentals from Second Chance Productions AND talk 30 years since the death of Harvey Milk, great LGBTQ Human Rights Advocate. :)
Muppet madness, Tempermantal-ness and the power of people...
All this and MORE...whew...we're out of breath!!

item.title: QueerFM : FunDrive 2011 with The Tempermentals & Vancouver Radical Faeries!
item.description:
It's that ONE time a year when CiTR asks YOU, the listener to support our shows - and QueerFM's family of shows need YOU! Check out CiTR.ca and DONATE!
Celebrating 18 years of LGBTQ programming AND on the Trans Day of Remembrance....we serve up drama AND joy...
We start off with News briefs and discussion with Aedan, Justin & Samantha including Prop 18 decisions, MORE issues with Trans rights...and more from around the world...then...
We have one of the leads and director of The Tempermentals from Second Chance Productions AND Marmot & Snap Dragon from the Radical Faeries - to talk about the history of THEN...and the joy of NOW. Listen in...you'll get it. :)
Muppet madness, Prince Poppycock and International Un-Friend Day...
All this and MORE...whew...we're out of breath!!

item.title: QueerFM : CUT - The Film, West Side Story, DADT & other injustices...
item.description:
SO MUCH to do on this PACKED QueerFM - Let's get down to it! News briefs and discussion with Aedan & Jennifer including human rights vs. freedom of speech in Saskatchewan, DADT fallout, Herman Cain on choice...and Dan Savage on OTHER choices. Justin Saint talks with Colin Ainsworth about Vancouver Opera's West Side Story - and Glen Callendar of the CAN-FAP brings Eli Unger-Sargon, filmmaker of CUT - The Film to talk the religious dogma and medical policies of circumcision. Ouch!
All this and MORE...whew...we're out of breath!!

item.title: QueerFM : Remembering Jack Layton 1950-2011
item.description:
QueerFM talks about the passing of a friend to the LGBTQ community, Canada as a nation - and a GREAT man. Jack Layton touched many of our lives - and this is QueerFM's tribute to him.
Join NEW host Jennifer Breakspear, and host emeritus and QueerFM creator, Heather Kitching along with Aedan & Justin Saint and Samantha Mack as we share clips, recollections and a SPECIAL surprise...
Heather Kitching brings back a conversation she had with Jack Layton from 2004 just PRIOR to the passage of LGBT Marriage legislation passage!
And...there's MORE...

item.title: QueerFM : OutGames Wrap-up from QMUNITY!
item.description:
Another day and night of OutGames sports, human rights conference and activities completed...and CiTR is here to wrap up the day - hosted by QMUNITY and featuring hosts from QueerFM QMUNITY! On tonight's broadcast: Mr. CBlaze presents clips from CiTR Sports Team with Wilson Wong.
Samantha Mack, Neo, Jazmine & Calvin talk OutGames Human Rights Conference...the foreskin controversy, 'genderless' children...and much more.
Jennifer Breakspear, Executive Director of QMUNITY drops by to explain 'Give A Damn, Give a DAY'...and why we SHOULD (and DO!)
David Holtzman of Vancouver's Out on Screen talks Youth Programs, the impact of film and youth programs for the LGBTQ community. Get involved...or just enjoy the films...
Tim Van Horne of CanadianMosaic.ca comes OUT from his tent...and talks about his amazing photo project documenting the diversity of Canada AND his other project PrideMosaic.ca!
We ALL share our brief 'coming out' stories...and the differences between generations.
All this and more from QMUNITY - Vancouver's BC's Queer Resource Center!

item.description:

item.title: QueerFM : Confessions of a Mad Drag Queen & Evil Patrick Shannon gets real in Vancouver
item.description: QueerFM is on point with Justin Saint and C. Blaze talking with the director and cast of 'Confessions of a Mad Drag Queen' a fantastic local production touching on many social issues we all deal with - running during Vancouver PRIDE Week and the 2011 North American OutGames. It's an interview not to be missed! Samantha Mack heads up a lively interview with 'Evil Patrick' Shannon - Vancouver Filmmaker and extraordinary artist discussing his latest CR Avery co-project 'Dungeon of Love' and 'Fall of Batman'. 'Dungeon' is a 1930's Vancouver Noir style film, music and spoken word piece with cameos from many local performance artists and labour of love 'Fall of Batman' details Bruce Wayne's financial demise and break with Robin - and their aftermath. Hilarious and not to be missed. Aedan Saint discusses GOP crazy and commentary featuring Drag U alum Lady Bunny and her take on 'post modern gay' apathy...and more news and politics as USUAL. It's a packed show with new Canadian music from Friends of 7 amongst others...so tune in and check it OUT! QueerFM broadcasts on CiTR 101.9FM Vancouver EVERY Sunday 6-8PM - with sister shows QueerFM QMUNITY from 5-6PM Sundays and QueerFM Arts Xtra at it's new weekly timeslot Tuesday mornings 9:30-10:30AM! Get all the details, past podcasts, blogs, photos and so much more at QueerFMVancouver.com or CiTR.ca! My Podcast Alley feed! {pca-7587d66bb8525b5227329ab964e93191}

item.description:
It's a PACKED show this week with a GREAT conversation with Vancouver LGBTQ Activist and Local Gay Man about town - Ryan Clayton. Ryan talks about challenges and triumphs with the community, and discusses the Toronto definition of the 'Post Modern Gay'...and more. Add to that discussion of latest concert and play series including Britney Spears and why all the boys on the crew love Christina Aguilera better, THE Samantha Mack talking 'Things to say that make a man UN-DATEABLE...and 2011 OutGames UPDATE....

* Aradia Fitness Pole Dancing for Fitness * Ace Angels International * Bellydance Vancouver * Diamond Minx & Maggie Pie Burlesque * Miss Pole Dance Canada 2010, Crystal Lai * Miss Taboo Latex Fashion Show courtesy of Wears & Ware Ventures Inc. * Miss Taboo Bikini Pageant courtesy of AK Traders * Miss Taboo Professional body Painting Competition courtesy of Ace Angels International * Wild West Cancan & Dazzling Divas * FEATURE PERFORMER... item.title: QueerFM : Best of 2010 with 2011 Resolution!
item.description:
Bid 2010 GOODBYE with music from Daft Punk, Lady Gaga, and special tracks from Peter Breeze & Maxwell Maxwell as well as the AMAZING NessaV!
Start your GET FIT resolution NOW with Maestro Devon Boorman, amazing sword fighter and instructor from Acadamie Duello!
PLUS...the END of 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell!'
Get it all with host Aedan Saint....
item.itunes:subtitle: Special Guest - Devon Boorman of Acadamie Duello!!

item.title: QueerFM : LAST show of 2010 with Diamond Minx!
item.description: Join host Aedan Saint as QueerFM interviews Vancouver burlesque fabulanista and sultry trouble maker - Diamond Minx! She'll be on to speak about the Naked Girls Reading Series, Don't Ask, Don't Tell...and drag queen names...amongst other things... ;)

item.title: QueerFM : Guest hosting MONDO TRASHO!!!
item.description:
Aedan Saint fills in for Maxwell Maxwell. Beats ensue!!
BEATS...not beatings!! (Silly Rabbit!)

item.title: QueerFM : Mr. Vancouver Leatherman Weekend - the Interview!
item.description: Check out our special guests from Vancouver Men in Leather including the outgoing Mr. Vancouver Leatherman 2010! Music, politics and MORE!!

item.title: QueerFM : CiTR Pledge Drive 2010!
item.description: TSA badness, Geek Radio requests and the CiTR FunDrive 2010!
item.itunes:subtitle: Geek Radio!

item.title: QueerFM : Stiletto Kill, DADT, It Gets Better with Ms. Spelt!
item.description: QueerFM is pleased to have Natalia - singer/songwriter/bass guitarist from Seattle band Stiletto Kill, more on 'Don't Ask, Don't Tell", and thoughts on the 'It Gets Better' project with special performance by The Svelte Ms. Spelt!

item.title: Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence - Vancouver...and crazy politics!
item.description: We welcome the new Mission of the Sisters of Perpetual Indulgence - Vancouver...the Abbey of the Long Cedar Canoe on the program...prepare for GLITTER in the control room!!

item.title: QueerFM : Pre-US Midterm Elections and 'It Gets Better'
item.description: Commentary on the US Midterm Elections, Christine O'Donnell burns up the Internet...and is NOT a Witch, and It Gets Better...or does it?

item.title: QueerFM : Fall Shape Up! with Shauna Magrath and Samantha Mack
item.description:
Check out QueerFM's Fall Shape Up! segment with Award winning Hollywood Makeup and Permanent Makeup Artist - Shauna Magrath from BeautyInk.ca and Samantha Mack our FAVE burlesque performer, dancer and MC....as we look at making your skin look SO much better. Tips and tricks...and for both men and women!
"It Gets Better" message from Aedan Saint...and Samantha Mack...and Shauna Magrath!
item.itunes:subtitle: It Gets Better!!

item.title: QueerFM with Kele Fleming
item.description:
Singer/songwriter Kele Fleming enchants us at QueerFM during her Vancouver tour and concert at the Cultch!
Check our her fabulous music, the witchcraft of Christine O'Donnell, US Tea Party craziness...and the Duke University F-list THESIS!

item.title: QueerFM with Velvet Steele
item.description: QueerFM has a rather enlightening discussion about LGBTQ Youth Bullying, the recent ruling on Sex Worker legislation and other current topics during an EXTENDED interview with Sex Educator, organizer and Dominatrix...Velvet Steele!

item.title: QueerFM with MGV XXXI Candidates
item.description: Mr & Ms Gay Vancouver XXXI Candidates, LGBTQ offerings at the Vancouver International Film Festival, DADT results...or lack thereof - and much more!

item.title: QueerFM - Slick Moorehead, DADT & Lick's MAN UP Show!
item.description:
Special Guest Slick Moorehead, Drag King and Mr. Gay Vancouver 30.5 discusses how drag kings are born and his take on DADT, DADT coverage and Paige Frewer (ponyboy) talks about MAN UP! - the longest running Drag King show in Vancouver BC at Lick.
Packed show...with MANY surprises!!

item.title: QueerFM - Odyssey Reduex
item.description:
A Loving Spoonful, This Way Out, Elvis and...
...wish you were at the Odyssey's last night? We recorded two additional hours of DJ Drew and a rockin' party last week. There was even a Peter Breeze sighting!
Enjoy the love...

item.title: QueerFM: The LAST Boa Show from the Odyssey!!
item.description: Joan-E and Justine Tyme from the closing night of the Odyssey...

item.title: QueerFM: The LAST Boa Show from the Odyssey!!
item.description: Joan-E and Justine Tyme from the closing night of the Odyssey...

item.title: Broadcast on 22-Aug-2010
item.description:
Aedan Saint's first show as the new host of QueerFM...and a GREAT interview with pop cool artist - PETER BREEZE!
News, opinion...and Jon Stewart on 'the Gay Agenda'...on QueerFM!!
item.itunes:subtitle: QueerFM : Peter Breeze!

item.title: Broadcast on 01-Aug-2010
item.description: Heather's last recorded broadcast.
item.itunes:subtitle: Vancouver Pride Edition

item.title: QueerFM July 25, 2010
item.description:
Heather's LAST live broadcast at QueerFM after 17 years...we'll miss you Heather...
Great interviews, diverse music and lots of fun...Aedan Saint, new host of QueerFM is on the second hour...
item.itunes:subtitle: Vancouver Pride Society & Pride Parade Grand Marshal - Barb Snelgrove

item.title: 18-July-2010
item.description: Discussion of the National Organization of Marriage 'Tour', Vancouver Folk Fest Performers - Emma's Revolution and PRIDE Festival rundown!
item.itunes:subtitle: Rick Jacobs - Courage Campaign & Emma's Revolution

item.title: June 27, 2010
item.description: Toronto trans activist Susan Gapka on the G20 prtests in Toronto. Mr. Gay Vancouver Aedan Saint on East Side Pride and the Village Poetry Slam. ...AND we talk about sports teams in Chicago Pride.
item.itunes:subtitle: G20 protests and Aedan Saint

item.title: April 11, 2010
item.description: On tonight's show, 2009's Gay Top Model Calan Breckon reviews the Adam Lambert show. Then it's a feature interview with Nate Phelps, the estranged son of wildly homophobic pastor Fred Phelps. And finally, a chat with Chris Hampton of the ACLU, who gives us the latest on the Constance McMillan story.
item.itunes:subtitle: Fred Phelps' son Nate speaks out and Chris Hampton of the ACLU talks about Constance

item.title: March 28, 2010
item.description: Jeremy Dias of JersVision describes this week's queer student organizing conference in Vancouver. Susan Gapka reports on the Ontario Rainbow Health Conference that wrapped up Friday, plus part one of a several part This Way Out series on life for queers in Africa.
item.itunes:subtitle: Youth Conference, Health Conference, and Queers in Africa

item.title: March 7, 2010
item.description: In an annual Queer FM tradition, Barb Snelgrove calls in reports live from her Oscar party. Ken Boesem of Little Sisters, Jennifer Breakspear of Qmunity/Pride House and Sharalyn Jordon of the Rainbow Refugee Committee participate in a post-mortem on the Olympics. This Way Out discusses Obama's plans to repeal Don't Ask Don't Tell, and the Audiofile brings us the top queer indie music releases of the month of February.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oscar Party, Olympics redux, Obama on Don't Ask Don't Tell and the top queer tunes of Feb.

item.title: February 21, 2010
item.description: Photographer Jeff Sheng was in Whistler this weekend to open his show Fearless at Whistler Pride House. Fearless is an exhibit of photographs of out queer athletes. 1992 gold medalist Mark Tewksbury was also at Pride House this week. I talked to him about Pride House and life for queer athletes. Also, I chat with queer Olympic Historians Charley Walters and Tyler Duckworth of Olympics or Bust, and I air audio from Friday's queer celebration at BC Canada House.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jeff Sheng photographs out athletes, Mark Tewksbury talks about gay athletes, and more

item.title: February 14th, 2010
item.description: Lots of audio on tonight's show from the opening parties of Pride House Whistler and Pride House Vancouver. Plus, Sharolyn Jordan of the Rainbow Refugee Committee talks about preparing to help gay Olympic vistors seek asylum. And I have a feature interview with lesbian athlete Marion Lay, bronze medalist in swimming at the 1968 Olympics and past board member of VANOC.
item.itunes:subtitle: Olympic Pride House openings and a chat with gay Olympian Marion Lay

item.title: January 24, 2010
item.description: Lawyer and activist Douglas Elliott discusses the hearing of the case against Canadian Blood Services over its discrimination against gay blood donors. Douglas is representing the Canadian AIDS Society in the case. Also, syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner talks about the hearing of the federal same sex marriage cast in San Francisco. Plus, good news from City Councilor Ellen Woodsworth!
item.itunes:subtitle: Canadian Blood Services challenged in court, same sex marriage on trial in USA

item.title: January 3, 2010
item.description: Groundbreaking BC queer activist and Queer FM regular Peter Corren died on December 30th after a three year battle with cancer. Most of this program was spent paying homage to him. I also aired the to queer indie music of 2009 courtesy of This Way Out's AudioFile.
item.itunes:subtitle: A Tribute to Peter Corren + the top queer indie music of 2009

item.title: November 15, 2009
item.description: Highlights from 16 years of Queer FM programs - including - my chat with one of the lesbians arrested at the Beijing women's conference in 1995 - the night we held a BC Human Rights Commission hearing on the radio on the issue of human rights protection for trans people - our conversation with the Fort Collins, CO gay centre ed the night Matthew Shepherd died - Kevin Bourassa's description of the day they were married at the MCC in Toronto amid bomb threats and CIA style security. - John Fisher and Michael Hendricks' hilarious commentaries on the same sex marriage hearings. - Our equally hilarious and exciting conversations with couples immediately following the decisions that allowed them to get married. And much more!
item.itunes:subtitle: Highlights from 16 years of Queer FM - the fund-drive show

item.title: November 8, 2009
item.description: First, I air a segment from the Queer FM archives from the night Matthew Shepherd died, then it's This Way Out's story on the new book about Matthew written by his mother, Judy. Next, syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner discusses the defeat of same sex marriage in Maine, then Josh Friedes of the Approve 71 campaign in Washington State and California campaign consultant Terry Leftgoff discuss whether the queer community needs to change strategies in the fight for marriage. Finally, This Way Out brings us more coverage of last month's National Equality March.
item.itunes:subtitle: Maine loses marriage, new book on Mathew Shepherd, more on the Equality March

item.title: October 11, 2009 - Coming Out Day
item.description: Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner reports on today's Equality March in Washington DC, Sirius OutQ News Director Tim Curran reports on Obama's speach to the Human Rights Campaign fundraising dinner. Jennifer Breakspear of Qmunity shares local coming out resources in recognition of Coming Out Day.
item.itunes:subtitle: Equality March in DC, Obama addresses queers, coming out resources for Coming Out Day

item.title: September 13th, 2009
item.description: On this episode, US army private Skyler James talks about her battle to stay in Canada as a refugee after fleeing anti-gay abuse on her military base. Dan Quon of Team Vancouver describes the OutGames in Copenhagen and we meet two of the contestants for Mr. and Ms. Gay Vancouver and see how well they do with beauty pageant questions.
item.itunes:subtitle: Queer US army private seeks refugee status, OutGames redux and Mr. and Ms. Gay Vancouver contestants

item.title: August 2, 2009
item.description: In honour of Pride, I completely violate the CRTC's campus radio requirements concerning the playing of obscure music and Canadian Content. Instead, I bring you two hours of queer club classics. Pardon the occasional technical glitches. iTunes was not designed to be a DJ tool.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Pride Party Mix 2009

item.title: July 19, 2009
item.description: Jamie Lee Hamilton, Reigan D'Angelo and Beth Marston talk about Lu's Pharmacy's policy of discriminating against transwomen. Vancouver's Gay Top Model Calan Breckon reports on Gay Day at Playland. Queer Indie Rock God Sam Martorana introduces this year's Polaris Prize nominees.
item.itunes:subtitle: Trans discrmination at Lu's Pharmacy and Polaris Prize nominees

item.title: Queers in Iran, Queers on Michael Jackson, Queers and the Whitehouse
item.description: Tonight on the show, Arsham Parsi of the Iranian Queer Railroad talks about the Iranian election protests from the perspective of the queers in Iran he's in touch with. Cultural panelists Calan Breckon (Vancouver's Gay Top Model), Susan Gapka (Cdn Trans Human Rights Commission) and Martine Stonehouse (CTHRC)discuss the passing of Michael Jackson. And This Way Out covers the growing rift between US queers and the Obama Administration.
item.itunes:subtitle: June 28th, 2009

item.title: June 21st, 2009
item.description: In honour of the 40th Anniversary of the Stonewall uprising this coming Saturday, I speak with Mark Segal, Stonewall veteran and publisher of the Philidelphia Gay News. I also air This Way Out's coverage of the Stonewall Anniversary, including tape from a pre-stonewall meeting of activists. And finally, lesbian singer-songwriter and musical comedienne Kate Reid joins me to set up her CD launch this Thursday at the WISE Hall.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stonewall's 40th and Kate Reid

item.title: May 31st, 2009
item.description:
Syndicated journalist Rex Wockner discusses the California Supreme Court's decision to uphold Prop 8; Canadian Love Exiles Steve Rowe and Thom Vernon talk about the Prop 8 rallies in Toronto and Vancouver; musical comedian and homo pop star Jay Spears talks about the Prop 8 rally in Los Angeles; and I play two new pro gay marriage YouTube videos.
A disclamer: Jay Spears claims on this program that Jody Foster spoke at the LA Prop 8 rally. He emailed me later to say it was actually Drew Barrymore. Jay's cub reporter license has been suspended for two weeks while he catches up on his reading of The National Enquirer. :-)
item.itunes:subtitle: All Prop 8 all the time

item.title: May 17th, 2009
item.description: On tonight's post-election Arts Edition gay top model Calan Breckon reports on Thursday's Fit for a Queen; David C. Jones talks about the new Out TV improv comedy show Tops and Bottoms; Troy Jackson introduces his debut album; This Way Out's Audiofile brings us the top queer indie music releases of the month of April; and Ember Swift talks about her new Chinese/English folk/electronica album Lentic.
item.itunes:subtitle: Arts Edition: Fit for a Queen, Ember Swift, OUT TV's new show, Enjoy Troy & more!

item.title: May 3rd, 2009
item.description: Vancouver West End NDP MLA Spencer Herbert and Liberal challenger Laura McDiarmid discuss and debate the issues heading into the May 12th election and Gay Top Model Calan Breckon reports on the Xtra West community hero awards. Plus This Way Out's interview with lesbian pulp fiction author Anne Bannon.
item.itunes:subtitle: West End election debate/discussion, Community Hero awards, Anne Bannon

item.title: April 19th, 2009
item.description: A spirited discussion with Craig Maynard, co-chair of The Centre board, and barbara findlay, local lawyer, activist and member of an ad hoc group of community members urging The Centre not to move to a proposed new location at Burrard and 7th. Also, Insp. John DeHaas of the Vancouver Police Department talks about what can be done about the increasing anti-gay violence in the West End. And I play the now-infamous "Gathering Storm" ad from the National Organization for Marriage and a couple of its many many parodies.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Centre moving to Burrard? VPD officer John DeHaas on anti-gay violence and the Gathering Storm

item.title: April 5th, 2009
item.description: Justin of One Iowa talks about this week's state supreme court decision legalizing same sex marriage in the state. Aaron Ursacki, winner of last year's Gay Top Model cycle talks about what newly-minted winner Calan Breckan has to look forward to. Plus the top queer indie music releases from This Way Out's Audiofile and This Way Out's interview with Ali Sands, who is writing a memoire about being the partner of a transitioning transman.
item.itunes:subtitle: Iowa same sex marriage, Vancouver's Gay Top Model, new queer music + trans memoire

item.title: March 29th, 2009
item.description: Richard Elliott of the Canadian HIV AIDS Legal Network talks about efforts to reform Canada's Access to Medications Regime. Ron Stipp and Jennifer Breakspear discuss the increasing anti-gay violence in the West End and their communications with the police and community on the matter. This Way Out brings us an archived interview with legendary gay activist and politician Harvey Milk.
item.itunes:subtitle: West End violence, Harvey Milk and getting AIDS drugs to the third world

item.title: March 22nd
item.description: Queer Thoughts blogger Rick Barnes talks about the appointment of anti-gay Doug Cryer to the Toronto Immigration and Refugee Board. Rev. Gary Patterson talks about his Oscar Sermon Series at St. Andrews Wesley Church, and Imtiaz Popat plugs next weekend's mini-film fest in honour of the Persian New Year.
item.itunes:subtitle: Anti gays on the immigration board, Oscar sermons and the mini Persian film fest

item.title: March 15th, 2009
item.description: Syndicated journalist Rex Wockner reports on the California Supreme Court hearing on lawsuits aimed at overturning proposition eight. Gens Helquist of the Canadian Rainbow Health Coalition discusses a Human Rights Complaint he brought with several fellow activists about homophobia in the healthcare system. Plus stories from This Way Out on queer life in Turkey and Project Runway alumnus Jay McCarrol.
item.itunes:subtitle: California Prop 8 hearing and Canadian complaint re: homophobia in health care

item.title: March 1st, 2009
item.description: Actress Angela Vint, star of the film "The Baby Formula," which premiers in Vancouver at the Women in Film Festival on Wednesday night. Dancer Ron Stewart, who performs WhaT,? at the Vancouver International Dance Festival March 13th and 14th and the top queer indie music releases of February courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Arts Edition: The Baby Formula, WhaT,? and February's top queer music

item.title: February 22nd, 2009
item.description: It's a Queer FM tradition on Oscar night: Barb Snelgrove and Connie Smudge provide highly entertaining Oscar party reports throughout the show. Plus, I talk to Stu Allen, a young straight man who's fighting to legalize same sex marriage in Colorado and Sarah MacDougall, a local Swedish-Canadian alt.country singer-songwriter who's launching a new CD Thursday at the WISE Hall. And in honour of Black History Month, Jason Colantonio of CiTR's Shake A Tailfeather, joins me to play some queer artists from the classic RnB era.
item.itunes:subtitle: Oscar Party!, straight queer marriage activist Stu Allen, Sarah MacDougall and classic queer RnB

item.title: February 15th, 2009
item.description:
Tonight on Queer FM, special guest Chris the engineer fixes the phone system live on air while Heather talks to syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner about the protest outside the Manchester Hyatt in San Diego today. Former US President Bill Clinton gave a speach there this afternoon despite pleas from the community to avoid the hotel they are boycotting because of the owners support for Proposition 8.
Also, Murray and Peter Corren discuss the Abbotsford school board's decision to offer Social Justice 12 in schools there this fall.
Plus, This Way Out's stories on a forthcoming documentary about the spiritual side of being queer and on the queer subtext of an early Ray Bradbury play.
item.itunes:subtitle: Queers protest Clinton in San Diego, The Correns on the Abbotsford school board

item.title: February 8th, 2008
item.description:
Jerry Gaudet of Pink Triangle Press, Jim Deva of Little Sisters and Jennifer Breakspear of the Centre discuss whether they are feeling the impact of the recession.
Akim Larcher of Egale Canada talks about the Queering Black History honourees.
And from Yin Radio, the presentation of a study on lesbian pulp fiction and the creation of lesbian identity.
item.itunes:subtitle: How the economy is affecting queers, queering black history and lesbian pulp fiction

item.title: February 1st, 2009
item.description: Queer Conservative organizer, Gary Mitchell discusses this week's federal budget ... and the superbowl game. This Way Out's coverage of gay episcopal bishop Gene Robinson's invocation at the Obama inauguration concert. Sean Horlor provides the first of what will be regular synopses of the Vancouver's Next Gay Top Model competition, and This Way Out's Audiofile introduces the top queer indie music releases of the month of January.
item.itunes:subtitle: Federal budget, more inauguration, Gay Top Model and This Way Out's Audiofile

item.title: January 25th, 2009
item.description: Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner talks about yesterday's Equality Summit in LA, aimed at disecting the failed No on Prop 8 campaign and stratetgizing for winning back marriage in California. Jess Durfee, chair of the Sand Diego county Democratic Party talks about attending the Obama inauguration and Terry Costa sets up round two of Vancouver's Next Gay Top Model.
item.itunes:subtitle: Obama Inauguration, Equality Summit, Gay Top Model

item.title: January 18th, 2009
item.description: Queer FM goes "Oprah" with a show on "how to live your better queer life." Guests are dietition Gerry Kasten, personal trainer Craig Boyd and counsellor Janel Ball.
item.itunes:subtitle: The New Years resolution program

item.title: January 11, 2009
item.description: A special feature in light of the insane weather conditions of the last few weeks: Mr. Gay Vancouver Brent Wildefyre and Ms. Gay Vancouver Jackie A-go-go both talk about the personal experiences of homelessness that inspired them to use their reign to raise money for charities benefiting homeless youth.
item.itunes:subtitle: Mr. and Ms. Gay Vancouver on homelessness

item.title: January 4th, 2009
item.description: Steve Pride presents the best queer movies and TV of 2008 in Pride on Screen 2008. 365gay.com editor Jennifer (Jay) Vanasco shares her Top 8 viral videos of 08, and we listen to clips.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Best of Everything Part 2

item.title: December 28th, 2008
item.description: Synidcated columnist Richard Burnett talks about his Heroes and Zeros for 2008 as detailed in his Three Dollar Bill column. This Way Out's Audiofile picks the best queer indie music releases of 2008. Michael from Little Sisters talks about his favourite queer books of 2008 and Aka reveals the greatest new sex toys of the year.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Best of Everything! Part 1

item.title: December 21st , 2008
item.description: The gay Dr. Phil, Kimeron Hardin, talks about how to handle the holiday blues, Heather gets holiday gift ideas from Stuart and Aka at Little Sister's and Steve Pride presents a feature on the film, Milk.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Holiday Show!

item.title: December 14th, 2008
item.description: Vancouver East NDP MP Libby Davies talks about the recent political crises in Ottawa and what to expect from here. Join the Impact founder Amy Balliet talks about the origins of the organization and its recent and upcoming events. Mr. Gay Vancouver Brent Wildefyle tees up some up-coming fundraisers for homeless youth.
item.itunes:subtitle: Libby Davies, Amy Balliett and Mr. Gay Vancouver

item.title: December 7th, 2008
item.description: Former Egale Canada ED Gilles Marchildon and Montreal marriage activist Michael Hendricks discuss the political happenings of the past week. Glen Hansman of the Vancouver Elementary School Teachers Association talks about the queer youth rally in Abbotsford protesting the school board's cancellation of Social Justice 12. Music honouring the anniversary of the Ecole Polytechnique massacre, and the top queer indie music releases of November courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: Political crisis in Ottawa, Queer youth rally in Abbotsford, Dec. 6th commorated in music, and the This Way Out Audiofile

item.title: November 16th, 2008
item.description: Long-time queer marriage and education activist Murray Corren cohosts the first fund-drive show ...and discusses the civic election results in some key school board races. Actvists around the US report from Prop 8-inspired rallies across the country, and California marriage activist Robin Tyler puts the current uprising in historical context. Plus, audio of mayor-elect Gregor Robertson at Saturday night's Vision Vancouver victory party.
item.itunes:subtitle: Stonewall 2.0, civic elections and fund drive fund drive fund drive!

item.title: November 9th, 2008
item.description: Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner describes the mounting protests throughout California in the wake of the victory for Proposition 8, the constitutional amendment banning gay marriage in the state. Freedom to Marry's Evan Wolfson talks about lessons learned from the battle, strategies for overturning the California measure and taking the marriage movement forward.
item.itunes:subtitle: Recap of the US Election and anti-marriage ballot measures

item.title: October 26th, 2008
item.description: Park board commissioner and provincial NDP candidate talks about the upcoming by-election in Vancouver Burrard. This Way Out marks the tenth anniversary of the Matthew Sheppher murder, and TWO also covers the Iranian president Mahmoud Ahmadinejad's latest remarks about the execution of gays in Iran.
item.itunes:subtitle: Vancouver Burrard by-election, Matthew Shepherd anniversary, Ahmadinejad

item.title: October 19th, 2008
item.description: Gemma Hickey of St. John's, Michael Hendricks of Montreal and Keith Purdy of Calgary discus Tuesday's election results. This Way Out covers the Connecticut Supreme Court decision legalizing same sex marriage.
item.itunes:subtitle: Election post-mortem and marriage in Connecticut

item.title: October 12th, 2008
item.description: This Way Out reviews Republican Vice Presidential nominee Sarah Palin's comments on queer issues from the past couple of weeks. It also features a Human Rights Campaign staffer's documentary about meeting queer activists in Wasilla, Alaska. Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner reviews both the VP debate and the second presendential debate between McCain and Obama and discusses the battle to amend the California constitution to bar same sex marriage. He also quickly discussus this week's Connecticut Supreme Court decision legalizing same sex marriage in that state. And in non-political news, we check out the top queer independent musical releases of the month of September courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: Catching up on the US election campaign and the same sex marriage battles

item.title: October 5th, 2008
item.description: Kim Vance of Arc International (who is based in Halifax), marriage activist Michael Hendricks (based in Montreal) and queer rights lawyer Doug Elliott (based in Toronto) discuss how the election campaign is shaping up in their regions in light of this week's leaders debates. Then Heather engages in a good-natured argument with gay Conservative organizer and Queer FM Conservative pundit Gary Mitchell.
item.itunes:subtitle: Election election election: Cross-Canada check-in and Conservative pundit time

item.title: September 28th, 2008
item.description:
This week on the program, Liberal pundit Joan-E and Green pundit Imtiaz Popat reflect on the campaign so far.
The This Way Out / Philidelphia Gay News interview with Barack Obama
And syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner on the US presidential debate.
...plus clips from Saturday Night Live and Catie Couric's interview with Sarah Palin.
item.itunes:subtitle: Canadian Election / American Election week #3

item.title: August 17th, 2008
item.description: More on the Anglican Church's global Lambeth conference with Steve Schuh and Chris Ambidge. A recap of the International AIDS Conference in Mexico City with Centre for Excellence Researcher Kate Shannon. Performer Evalyn Parry talks about the Toronto performance of The Pastor Phelps Project, based on anti-gay pastor Fred Phelps, and on Phelps' rumoured protest of the event.
item.itunes:subtitle: Lambeth, AIDS Conference, The Pastor Phelps Project

item.title: August 10th, 2008
item.description: Long-time CKNW talk-show host Rafe Mair discusses his victory at the Supreme Court in Kari Simpson's defamation case against him. Performer and ex-gay advocate Peterson Toscano discusses his visit to England for the Anglican church's once-every-ten-years global Lambeth conference. Vanessa Kwan previews the Out on Screen queer film and video festival.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rafe Mair, the Lambeth Conference and Out on Screen

item.title: August 3rd, 2008
item.description: Queer FM celebrates Pride with 2 hours of queer dance anthems. The regular format returns next week.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Pride Party!

item.title: July 6th
item.description: Denise Sheppard previews the summer festivals, This Way Out's Audiofile presents the top queer indie rock releases of June, and Sam Martorana previews the Polaris nominee announcement.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Arts Edition

item.title: June 29th, 2008
item.description: Inspired by this week's in-fighting in California over the alleged "snub" of marriage litigant Robin Tyler by major equality groups, Heather talks to Canadian marriage activist Michael Hendricks about the politics that played out in the Canadian marriage struggle. Plus, from the radio show Raising Sand, and interview with Meema Spadola, making of the documentary "Our House" about kids of queer parents.
item.itunes:subtitle: The politics of same sex marriage + Documentary on kids of same sex parents

item.title: June 22nd, 2008
item.description: California marriage litigant - and ex-pat Canadian - Robin Tyler talks about the arrival of same sex weddings in California, audio from the big day courtesy of This Way Out, and Nadine talks about the Love Exiles, a support group for bi-national couples who have come to Canada so they can live together.
item.itunes:subtitle: Marriage in California and Love Exiles

item.title: June 8th, 2008
item.description:
Elizabeth Saewyc discusses new research on the incidence of sexual exploitation among youth at risk. Gay psychologist Kimeron Hardin discusses the reissue of his book on self esteem for GLBT folks.
...plus we try out a new theme. :-)
item.itunes:subtitle: A study on sexually exploited youth and a book on self esteem

item.title: May 25th, 2008
item.description: Spencer Herbert talks about his run for the provincial NDP, This Way Out's coverage of the California same sex marriage victory and Akim Larcher updates us on Egale's lobbying efforts against homophobia in Jamaica.
item.itunes:subtitle: Spencer Herbert runs for the NPD, more on Cali marriage and Egale Jamaica update

item.title: May 4th, 2008
item.description: Little Sister's' Metta Bach reviews the new Jane Rule book, clips from today's Little Sister's anniversary party, the top queer indie music releases of the month of April from This Way Out's Audiofile and the best new Canadian indie rock from Sam Martorana.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Arts Episode - The new Jane Rule book, new queer music and new indie rock

item.title: April 27th, 2008
item.description: Little Sisters' co-owner Jim Deva reflects on 25 years of business, plus some archival clips from Queer FM's coverage of the store's court case. Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner answer's questions about the Pennsylvania primary results and This Way Out's Steve Pride profile's Bravo's Jesse Brune.
item.itunes:subtitle: Little Sisters' Anniversary and the Pennsylvania primary

item.title: April 20th, 2008
item.description: Marianne Duddy-Burke talks about Dignity USA's actions around the Pope's US visit, Herndon Davis talks about the National Black Justice Coalition's upcoming conference, plus This Way Out's profile of the Two Spirit Press Room and Desmond Tutu's apology to gays.
item.itunes:subtitle: Gay Catholics protest the Pope, Black LGTB conference and more

item.title: April 13th, 2008
item.description: Trans organizers and activists Susan Gapka, Jay Theissen and Tien Wee discuss the case of Thomas Beattie and the surrounding publicity. Akim Larcher of Stop Murder Music talks about the organization and their success in persuading iTunes to pull anti-gay reggae tracks from it's on-line store. Plus, part 2 of This Way Out's profile of Olivia Records and Cruises.
item.itunes:subtitle: Pregnant man redux and the end of anti-gay reggae on itunes

item.title: February 24th, 2008
item.description: Nicky Phillips of AIS Canada previews the talk she'll be giving March 5th at the Centre's workshop on intersex issues. This Way Out reports on the situation for queers in Singapore, and Barb Snelgrove files regular reports from the Majestic's Oscar Party.
item.itunes:subtitle: Intersex issues and the Oscars

item.title: February 17th, 2008
item.description: Well-known Jamaican gay activist Gareth Henry of the group J-FLAG (Jamaican Forum for Lesbians All-Sexuals and Gays) has arrived in Canada seeking refugee status. He speaks to us from the home of Egale Executive Director Helen Kennedy, where he is currently staying. Jason Colantonio of CiTR's Friday night soul show, Shake A Tail Feather, introduces us to out queer artists from the 50s to 70s.
item.itunes:subtitle: Abbreviated show due to sports. Gareth Henry of JFLAG and queer soul r&b

item.title: February 10th, 2008
item.description: Nova Scotia activist Jane Morrigan discusses Pictou county's move to ban all "special interest flags" from public property - a move generally believed to be targeted at pride flags. Rex Wockner analyzes the results of Super Tuesday.
item.itunes:subtitle: Pictou pride flag troubles and Super Tuesday!

item.title: February 3rd, 2008
item.description: Egale executive director Helen Kennedy gives us the latest on efforts to overturn the new ban on queer organ donors - or even to find out what the heck is up with it. Kiran from Queer Montreal talks about the recent conference for Queer campus groups, and we check out the top queer indie music releases of the month of January courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: More on the queer organ donor ban, a conference for queer campus groups and the audiofile

item.title: January 13th, 2008
item.description: Egale Executive Director Helen Kennedy talks about Health Canada's ban on gay male organ doners and we review the top queer-themed films of 2007 with This Way Out's Steve Pride.

item.title: Queer FM - January 6th, 2007
item.description:
On this edition of Queer FM, we're joined by Matt Foreman, the Executive Director of the National Gay and Lesbian Task Force and Rex Wockner, syndicated journalist out of San Diego CA to talk about the Iowa Caucus results from a queer perspective.
Also, queer indie rock columnist Sam Martorana counts down his favourite songs over 2007
item.itunes:subtitle: Happy New Year!

item.title: November 4th, 2007
item.description: Jim Deva of Little Sister's discusses the impact of a soaring Canadian dollar on community businesses like the book store. Gay South Asian author and former CiTR program host Ameen Merchant talks about his debut novel "The Silent Raga." Pat Hogan of Sounds and Furies previews the first Canadian gay ballroom dance competition.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Unofficial "Literature Episode"

item.title: October 28th, 2007
item.description: Centre Executive Director Michael Harding pitches for volunteers for a series of new intiatives. Heather catches up with Arsham Parsi of the Iranian Queer Organization during a recent trip to Toronto (plus, we revisit the recent remarks of Iranian President Mahmoud Ahmadinejad), Heather also phones syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner in San Diego to make sure he's safe from the fires. And queer music columnist (er god) Sam Martorana introduces the latest greatest Canadian indie rock.
item.itunes:subtitle: New Centre initiatives, Catching up with the IRQO + music columnist Sam Martorana

item.title: September 30, 2007
item.description: A discussion of US Rep. Barney Frank's decision to strip trans protections from the US Employment Non Discrimination Act in order to pass it in the house, and the strategic question the move raises about whether gays and trans folks should hold out for equality until we can all gain it at once. Guests on the program are Canadian trans activists Tami Starlight and Susan Gapka, US queer journalist Rex Wockner and National Gay and Lesbian Task Force Executive Director, Matt Foreman.
item.itunes:subtitle: A discussion of trans inclusion in the US Employment Non Discrimination Act

item.title: September 16th, 2007
item.description: Lawyer El Farouk Khaki with the latest on Alvaro Orozco's case, This Way Out's coverage of the Larry Craig fiasco, more of their excerpts from the US presidential contenders forum on queer issues - including comments from Hilary Clinton - and the top queer independent music releases of August courtesy of the This Way Out Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: Orozco Update, more on Larry Craig, more from the US presidential contenders and new queer music

item.title: September 9th, 2007
item.description: Egale Canada Executive Director Helen Kennedy responds to member criticism about communication around the Ontario leaders debate on queer issues. Lawyer El Farouk Khaki gives us the latest on the Alvaro Orozco case, and queer journalist Rex Wockner shares the latest US news, including same sex marriage progress in Iowa and California and the scandal involving Republican Senator Larry Craig.
item.itunes:subtitle: Egale update, Orozco update, Marriage news from Iowa, More Republican gay sex scandals

item.title: August 26th, 2007
item.description: Audio from the US presidential contenders debate on queer issues courtesy of This Way Out; lawyer El Farouk Khaki with an update on the case of Alvaro Orozco, the man who was denied refugee status in Canada because authorities didn't believe he was gay; the top queer independent music releases of the month of July courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: More on the US presidential condender's debate, Orozco update and new queer music

item.title: August 19th, 2007
item.description: US Marriage Equality activist Robyn Ochs on the US Presidential candidates debate on queer issues, queer film critic Matthew Hays on his book "The View from Here: Conversations with Gay and Lesbian Film-Makers," and Michael Harding, the new Executive Director of The Centre.
item.itunes:subtitle: US Presidential contender's debate, Queers on film and the Centre's new ED

item.title: August 12th, 2007
item.description: Steve Schue of Integrity Vancouver on the Anglican Bishops' vote not to affirm diocese's rights to bless same sex unions. Robbie Hong on the recent Vancouver Two Spirit Gathering and highlights from Pride.
item.itunes:subtitle: Anglicans on same sex unions, The Two Spirit gathering and a Pride recap

item.title: July 15th, 2007
item.description: Peterson Toscano talks about the Beyond Ex Gay Conference held the Canada Day long weekend in California. The top queer indie music releases from the month of June courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile, and Folk Fest discoveries.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ex-Ex Gay conference, new queer tunes, and Folk Fest tunes

item.title: June 24th, 2007
item.description: Queer Music columnist Sam Martorana calls in from Toronto Pride. Centre board co-chair Craig Maynard, Centre outreach coordinator Peter Toppings and former Centre volunteer coordinator Pat McDiarmid share their memories of outgoing executive director Donna Wilson. Donna Wilson shares her memories of work at the Centre. This Way Out, the syndicated LGTB radio magazine, shares its interview with Lilly Tomlin.
item.itunes:subtitle: Toronto Pride, Lilly Tomlin and Donna Wilson leaves the Centre.

item.title: June 10th, 2007
item.description: Robbie Hong on the upcoming Two Spirit gathering in Vancouver, This Way Out brings us part one of a media conference marking the 30th Anniversary of the White House gay summit in the US and Sam Martorana brings us more new Canadian indie pop and rock.
item.itunes:subtitle: Two Spirit gathering preview, 30th anniversary of the US Queer Summit and new music!

item.title: May 28th, 2007
item.description: Doug Elliott on the Supreme Court of Canada's decision on access to justice, This Way Out celebrates the crystal anniversary of same sex marriage in Massachusettes and we meet our new music columnist, Sam Martorana.
item.itunes:subtitle: Access to justice, the anniversary of ssm in Mass, new music!

item.title: May 20th, 2007
item.description: Elizabeth Saewyc of the McCreary Centre Society and the UBC School of Nursing discusses new research on street involved youth, including the percentage of homeless youth who are lgtb. Rev. Peter Elliott of Christ Church Cathedral discusses the lastest news in the Anglican church's dispute over the role of queers, including a recent pastoral statement by Canadian Bishops calling for a moratorium on the blessing of same sex unions. Plus This Way Out's coverage of the progress of the US Local Law Enforcement Act.
item.itunes:subtitle: Homelessness among queer youth, the Anglican church's dispute over queers and the US Local Law Enforcement Act

item.title: May 13th, 2007
item.description: In honour of Mental Health Week: a rebraodcast of my chat with queer psychologist and author Kimeron Hardin about maintaining mental health, and a rebroadcast of my chat with Devon MacFarlane of Vancouver Coast Health about Prism Alcohol and Drug Services. Plus a brief recap of the Eurovision Song Contest. :-)
item.itunes:subtitle: The mental wellnes show!

item.title: May 6th, 2007
item.description: Pierre Blais of the Fondation Emergence on the International Day Against Homophobia. Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner on the California Democratic convention and legislative developments on queer rights in the U.S. The top queer indie music releases of the month of April courtesy of This Way Out's Audiofile.
item.itunes:subtitle: International Day Against Homophobia, US political developments and new queer tunes

item.title: April 29th, 2007
item.description: Helen Kennedy, the new Executive Director of Egale Canada talks about her vision for the organization and addresses concerns raised during the past few months of Egale turmoil. This Way Out interviews gay historian Stuart Timmons about Larry Kramer's controversial speech on the 20th Anniversary of Act Up. A preview of upcoming community events and concerts ...and regular updates on the Canucks Ducks game, which Heather really knows nothing about.
item.itunes:subtitle: Egale's new ED and This Way Out analyzes Larry Kramer's speech

item.title: April 22nd 2007
item.description: Tamara Kronis shares the results of the Canadian Blook Services consultation with Egale and other interested parties. This Way Out's latest feature on openly gay Episcopal bishop of New Hampshire, Gene Robinson. Kenneth Anderson talks about his upcoming serious of glbt self-care workshops at The Centre.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Canadian Blood Services meeting / Bishop Gene Robinson / The Centre's self care workshop

item.title: April 15th, 2007
item.description: Egale's Tamara Kronis previews tomorrows meeting between queer and HIV/AIDs groups and Canadian Blood Services. Connie Smudge joins us for the debut cultural pundit panel. We talk out Out Magazine's glass closet issue and the controversy surrounding the GLAAD Media Awards.
item.itunes:subtitle: A preview of Egale's meeting with Cdn Blood Services / The debut of our cultural pundit panel

item.title: Apirl 8th, 2007
item.description:
Rosalyn Forrester, Michael Bach and Greg Daborn talk about the Outrights Conference in Calgary last weekend.
Peterson Toscano on the upcoming Beyond Ex Gay confence
This Way Out's Audiofile - the top queer independent releases of the month of March
item.itunes:subtitle: Outrights conference review, Beyond Ex Gay conference preview and top queer tunes

item.title: April 1st, 2007
item.description:
Michael Hendricks discusses the Quebec Election result
This Way Out's coverage of Larry Kramer's speech marking ACT UP's 20th Anniversary
Music by last night's Juno winners in the non-pop categories
item.itunes:subtitle: The QC Election and ACT UP's 20th Anniversary

item.title: March 25th, 2007
item.description:
Michael Hendricks on the lead up the the Quebec election.
Devon McFarlane of Vancouver Coastal Health on VCH's new alcohol and drug services for the LGTB community.
This Way Out's coverage of the Peter Pace affair
item.itunes:subtitle: Quebec election preview, Intro to Prism Alcohol and Drug Services and Peter Pace redux

item.title: March 18th, 2007
item.description:
Romi Chandra talks about his Pride and Prejudic workshop for the International Day for the Elimination of Racism.
Gay psychologist Kimeron Hardin on maintaining good mental health.
Part 2 of This Way Out's interview with Gareth from JFLAG, the Jamaica queer organization.
item.itunes:subtitle: Romi Chandra, Kimeron Hardin and Part 2 of Gareth from JFlag

item.title: March 4th, 2007
item.description:
A feature interview with Douglas Elliott, lawyer in the class action suit against the federal government concerning access to survivors pensions under CPP.
Plus, This Way Out's Audiofile - the best queer indie releases of February - and new music from Anais Mitchell and Evalyn Parry.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Supreme Court decides the Hislop case and we check out new queer music

item.title: Queer FM, February 18th, 2007
item.description: A recap of the IRQO symposium, featuring comments from Jessica Stern of Human Rights Watch, El Farouk Khaki of Salam, Hedy Fry, Barbara Hall and Niaz Salimi.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Iranian Queer Organization Symposium in Toronto

item.title: February 11th, 2007
item.description:
Kimberly Nixon's lawyer, barbara findlay, discusses the Supreme Court of Canada's refusal to hear the appeal of her case against Vancouver Rape Relief.
Ontario trans activist Susan Gapka shares her thoughts.
Toronto immigration lawyer, El Farouk Khaki talks about the case of Alvaro Orozco, the Nicaraguan man who was refused asylum in Canada because the refugee board refused to believe he's gay.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Nixon Case and the Orozco Case

item.title: January 14th, 2006
item.itunes:subtitle: Queer Palestinians and the Three Parent Case

item.title: Queer FM - January 7th, 2007
item.description:
Asham Parsi of the Iranian Queer Organization speaks about their upcoming forum in Toronto on queer rights in Iran.
Steve Pride counts down the top queer themed films of 2006
item.itunes:subtitle: Happy New Year!

item.title: Queer FM - December 31st, 2006
item.description: The top queer independent music releases of 2006 from This Way Out's Audiofile, The top queer news stories of 2006, and Queer FM's own 2006 musical disoveries.
item.itunes:subtitle: The New Years Eve Show!

item.title: Queer FM - December 17th, 2006
item.description:
Gay Conservative organizer, Gary Mitchell on the failure of Harper's motion to revisit same sex marriage, the future of the evangelical right in the party and Stephane Dion as leader of the Liberals.
Quebec activist Michael Hendricks on how Stephane Dion is being received in Quebec.
Toronto trans activist Susan Gapka on the Ontario Human Rights Tribunal ruling on access to SRS and the subsequent demonstration.
item.itunes:subtitle: Harper's marriage motion, how Dion is doing in Quebec, and the trans SRS decision

item.title: Queer FM - December 3rd, 2006
item.description:
Greg Elzinga of the Vancouver Centre Liberal Riding Association talks to us from his cell phone at Dorval airport about the outcome of the Liberal leadership convention
Edmonton activist Chris Wells on the outcome of the Alberta Conservative party leadership race
The top Queer independent music releases from This Way Out's Audiofile
Melissa Ferrick comments on her new CD, In the Eyes of Strangers
item.itunes:subtitle: The Liberal convention, the Alberta Conservative leadership race and new queer music

item.description:
Evan Wolfson of Freedom to Marry on the NJ Supreme Court's Same Sex Marriage Decision
Ken Mooney of CUPW on the Vancouver postal workers' protest of homophobic bulk mail
Janet Mason's book review
Steve Pride's preview of "Infamous" ...the second Truman Capote movie.
Murdoch, Heather's 18-year-old cockatiel cheaps in the background.

item.title: Queer FM, October 15th, 2006
item.description:
In celebration of International LGTB Coming Out Day October 11th:
Queer activists Mary Woo Sims, Gilles Marchildon and Michael Hendricks share their coming out stories.
Rebecca Sheilds of the Centre talks about the Centre's coming out resources.
This Way Out's often-humourous Coming Out Day piece.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Coming Out Day show!

item.description:
Laurie Arron of Canadians For Equal Marriage and queer ex-Conservative Gary Mitchel discuss "DORA."
Syndicated queer journalist Rex Wockner on the Mark Foley affair.
The top queer indie music releases of September from This Way Out's Audiofile segment
